game

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Node
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BoardElement, Colorable, UserData, org.json.JSONString

    public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
implements BoardElement
    A Node (vertex) on the board of the game. Each Node maintains (1) a set of edges that exit it, (2) A hashmap of trucks, mapping to either at this node or not at this node, and (3) a set of Parcels that are on this node (and not loaded on a truck).

    All methods that modify these collections are protected, but all getters are public for use by the user. Additionally, convenience methods such as isConnectedTo(Node n) are provided for user use.
    Author:
    MPatashnik

      • getExits

        public java.util.HashSet<Edge> getExits()
        Return a copy of the set of edges leaving this node. This is to prevent the addition of edges to exits without proper clearance.

      • getNeighbors

        public java.util.HashMap<Node,java.lang.Integer> getNeighbors()
        Return a map of neighboring nodes to the lengths of the edges connecting them to this Node. To iterate over a HashMap, use HashMap.entrySet().

      • isConnectedTo

        public boolean isConnectedTo(Node destination)
        Return false if destination.equals(this). Otherwise, Return true iff one of the edges in exits leads to Node destination, (this is connected to destination via a single edge).

      • getConnect

        public Edge getConnect(Node other)
        Return the road that this node shares with node other (null if not connected).

      • updateGUILocation

        public void updateGUILocation(int x,
                     int y)
        Update the circle graphic that represents this truck on the GUI. Do nothing if threads is null. Also update the location of the load if this truck is carrying one.
        Specified by:
        updateGUILocation in interface BoardElement
        Parameters:
        x - - the new X location of this Truck in the GUI
        y - - the new Y location of this Truck in the GUI

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object n)
        Return true iff n is a Node and is equal to this one. Two Nodes are equal if they have the same name - guaranteed to be unique within the context of a single game
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Return the hashCode of this node. Its hashCode is equal to the hashCode of its name. This is guaranteed to be unique within the context of a single game.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
